== Variants ==
== Variants ==
{{see also|List of Ubuntu-based distributions}}
{{see also|List of Ubuntu-based distributions}}
â
[[Image:Kubuntu-Kde4.jpeg|thumb|right|[[Kubuntu]] 8.04 KDE4 desktop]]
+
[[Image:Kubuntu 8.04 with KDE 4.png|thumb|right|[[Kubuntu]] 8.04 KDE4 desktop]]
Several official and unofficial variants Ubuntu exist. Of the official variants, [[Kubuntu]]<ref name="kubushipi">{{cite web | url=https://shipit.kubuntu.org/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Kubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-06-21}}</ref> and [[Edubuntu]]<ref name="edushipi">{{cite web | url=https://shipit.edubuntu.org/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Edubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-06-21}}</ref> are also available free of charge via mail order through Ubuntu's ShipIt service, but Xubuntu is not available.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://bugs.launchpad.net/shipit/+bug/62318|title=No shipit for xubuntu| accessdate=2008-06-10}}</ref> These Ubuntu variants simply install a set of packages different from the original Ubuntu, but since they draw additional packages and updates from the same [[Software repository|repositories]] as Ubuntu, all of the same software is available for each of them. Unofficial variants and derivatives are not controlled or guided by [[Canonical Ltd.|Canonical]] and are generally [[Fork (software development)|forks]] with different goals in mind. These different versions correspond to development efforts run by largely separate groups of people who try to bring different functionalities to the distribution. The official sister distributions are:<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.easy-ubuntu-linux.com/other-ubuntus.html | title=Other Ubuntus | accessdate=2007-06-07}}</ref>
Several official and unofficial variants Ubuntu exist. Of the official variants, [[Kubuntu]]<ref name="kubushipi">{{cite web | url=https://shipit.kubuntu.org/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Kubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-06-21}}</ref> and [[Edubuntu]]<ref name="edushipi">{{cite web | url=https://shipit.edubuntu.org/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Edubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-06-21}}</ref> are also available free of charge via mail order through Ubuntu's ShipIt service, but Xubuntu is not available.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://bugs.launchpad.net/shipit/+bug/62318|title=No shipit for xubuntu| accessdate=2008-06-10}}</ref> These Ubuntu variants simply install a set of packages different from the original Ubuntu, but since they draw additional packages and updates from the same [[Software repository|repositories]] as Ubuntu, all of the same software is available for each of them. Unofficial variants and derivatives are not controlled or guided by [[Canonical Ltd.|Canonical]] and are generally [[Fork (software development)|forks]] with different goals in mind. These different versions correspond to development efforts run by largely separate groups of people who try to bring different functionalities to the distribution. The official sister distributions are:<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.easy-ubuntu-linux.com/other-ubuntus.html | title=Other Ubuntus | accessdate=2007-06-07}}</ref>
